title: mesa > python > ncurses~termlib but mesa > llvm > ncurses+termlib
body:
[~/projects/spack (develop *$%=)]$ spack spec mesa
Input spec
--------------------------------
mesa

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: An unsatisfiable variant constraint has been detected for spec:

    ncurses@6.1%gcc@7.4.0~symlinks~termlib arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell
        ^pkgconf@1.6.3%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell


while trying to concretize the partial spec:

    llvm@6:
        ^cmake@3.4.3:
        ^perl-data-dumper
            ^perl@5.30.1%gcc@7.4.0+cpanm+shared+threads arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell
                ^gdbm@1.18.1%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell
                    ^readline@8.0%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell
                        ^ncurses@6.1%gcc@7.4.0~symlinks~termlib arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell
                            ^pkgconf@1.6.3%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell


llvm requires ncurses variant +termlib, but spec asked for ~termlib
This was caused by https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/14561 The fix would be to change llvm/pakage.py and and depend on ncurses not ncurses+termlib. If termlib is really needed, the ncourses/package.py should be changed to make termlib variant True.
